description: From Latin, from Ancient Greek διά (diá, “through, across”) + πέντε (pénte, “five”).

entries.meaning: (music, obsolete) The interval of the fifth or the harmonic ratio 3:2.
(medicine, obsolete) A composition of five ingredients.
examples: If the horse be in good fleſh and ſpirits when taken up for its month′s preparation, the diapente muſt be omitted; and the chief buſineſs will be to give him good food, and ſo much exerciſe as will keep him in wind, without overſweating him or exhauſting his ſpirits.
